title: North by Northwest 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Appealing aromas of black cherry, cocoa, herb, pencil lead and wood spice are followed by generous pit-fruit flavors. The tannins show some chalkiness and astringency.

title: North by Northwest 2015 Riesling (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This is a vibrantly aromatic wine, with notes of honeysuckle, lime leaf and peach. The palate drinks dry, with tart acidity and a broad feel, dipping a bit in the middle before coming back together.

title: Obalo 2013 Matulán Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Bold earthy black-fruit aromas properly announce a drawing, tannic middleweight with powerful plum, raspberry and tomato flavors. This cool-vintage Rioja is tough and sinewy on a highly tannic finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Oberon 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This classically styled wine offers black olive, dusty-leathery tannin and jolts of clove and cedar, bringing it all together in a soft, seamless varietal expression. Along the way, expect to meet a juicy hit of grenadine and black currant, a comfy marriage between savory and fruity.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2015 Txakoli Aitzalde Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Grassy aromas and a whiff of celery lead to a snappy palate with fresh but tart lemon, gooseberry and white-currant flavors. A juicy fresh finish with citrus flavors is typical of well-executed Txakoli.

title: Franklin Tate 2014 Tate Chardonnay (Margaret River)
description: This plump, succulent wine is a solid value. Understated toast frames pineapple and melon in this fruit-driven style. Drink this crisp, appealing quaffer now–2018.

title: Frederico Meireles & Familia 2010 Val Pedro Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This wine is solid, with firm tannins that are still masking the fruit. It is rich and still has the potential to give a ripe wine. For now, it is solid and firm with great tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: Hiruzta 2015 Txakolina Hondarribia Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A note of yeasty vanilla graces apple and citrus aromas. This feels chalky and minerally, with a touch of spritz. Dry lime and green-apple flavors finish clean and long, with no funk to speak of.

title: White Rose 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This tasty wine opens with savory scents of herb-speckled cranberries and red currants. It's a tight and tangy wine, that comes alive with aggressive aeration. Drink now through 2020.

title: Cristom 2014 Estate Syrah (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Not much Syrah is grown in the Willamette Valley, but Cristom has made it for quite some time now. Tart and astringent, this has black cherry and earth flavors, a light hint of fungus, and chewy tannins.

title: Caves Transmontanas 2012 Quanta Terra Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Full of red fruits and generous tannins, this is an immediately attractive wine. The red-berry fruits are balanced by good acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017 to allow the tannins to soften further.

title: Cerulean 2013 Red Sky Red (Washington)
description: Half Tempranillo, 40% Barbera and 5% each Merlot and Sangiovese, this is dry and fully mature, but quite tasty. Musky scents of roses and orange peel lead into a tart palate with wild berries, and a touch of citrus oil. Drink now through 2018.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 DFJ Touriga Nacional-Touriga Franca Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a very Douro blend for this wine from Lisboa region. It brings structure and minerality to fill out the dark-black fruits. With ripe tannins and bright acidity balancing the fruit, it is ready to drink.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2013 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Forward and fruity, this is a solid, drink any time Chardonnay. It's built in a blocky chunky mode, but some sleek lime flavors put a polished edge on the underlying acids.

title: Château Haut Barrail 2014  Médoc
description: The high proportion in the blend gives it its ripe, juicy character. The toasty wood aging flavors are just enough to allow it to fill out as it ages. With juicy black-currant and ripe-berry flavors, the wine will be perfumed and delicious from 2018.

title: Château Lamour 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is a small estate of 12 acres dominated by its 95% Merlot. It is ripe and juicy with spice, dried fruits and crisp black currants. The tannins are already well integrated with the fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.

title: Buena Vista 2014 Karoly's Selection Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)
description: This wine pushes the envelope on ripeness, not unusual for the variety. Toasted oak and black-cherry jam make up the majority of the experience, riding a supple wave of soft tannin and concentrated power.

title: Bulas 2009 Grande Reserva Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe, with plenty of tannins that give it a rich, structured character. It is dense with black-currant fruitiness. Drink from 2018.

title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Red (Douro)
description: With new-wood flavors as well as ripe berry fruits, this will be an attractive wine. Warm, ripe and fruity, it has concentration and potential. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Borgo Maragliano 2015 La Caliera  (Moscato d'Asti)
description: Intense aromas of thyme, white spring flower, citrus and exotic fruit lead the nose. On the soft palate, a frothy mousse frames white grapefruit, sage, apricot and yellow peach. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.

title: La Catrina NV Chardonnay (California)
description: Vibrant and concentrated, this light-bodied wine is one of the best of the flamboyantly packaged La Catrina line so far. Packed with vivid fruit flavor, it's lightly sweet but nicely balanced by fresh acidity and flavors like citrus and apple.

title: Parras Wines 2014 Quinta do Gradil Ruelas Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Still young, the wood-aging flavors show strongly in the toast and spice character of this wine. The black fruits are developing and will shortly balance out with the wood. Already the aftertaste is fruity and juicy. Drink this wine from late 2017.

title: Parras Wines 2015 Montaria Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Produced at the Candeeira estate in central Alentejo, this structured blend of local grapes includes Alicante Bouschet, giving the wine deep color. It has black fruits, balanced tannins and plenty of acidity to convey a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Red C 2014 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blend of Syrah, Malbec, Grenache and Merlot seems intended for contemplative consumption, with its baked-plum flavor accented in tar and cigar. Quite ripe and full bodied, it packs a punch, with swathes of toasty oak on the finish.

title: Terra d'Oro 2015 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this bottling is bright, fresh and clean, with lots of apple, Key lime and squeezed-citrus touches. Snappy pear flavors show first on the sip, then come riper yellow peach and cantaloupe, all framed by jubilant acidity. There's nothing too complex, but it's a refreshing sipper.

title: Pino 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Smooth and fruity, this has a dominant flavor of ripe apple, with highlights of orange candy. It's not off dry, but there is a strong impression of residual sugar, which feels a bit grainy. If you enjoy California Chardonnays with a touch of sweetness, this is a wine you'll like.

title: Poeira 2014 Pó de Poeira Red (Douro)
description: The second wine of Poeira, this is ripe and fruity, with soft tannins and bright acidity. It still has a young, firm edge although the fruit will allow it to develop well. Drink from 2020.

title: Gianni Gagliardo 2012 Preve  (Barolo)
description: Oak, coconut, espresso and menthol aromas lift out of the glass. The taut somewhat lean palate shows raw sour cherry, tart cranberry, espresso and oak-driven spice but not much fruit richness. Tight raspy tannins dry out the finish. Let the tannins soften for a few years then drink to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Eberle 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Simple sweet apple and poached pear notes meet with a slight tonic and guava nectar on the nose of this bottling that blends the Four Lanterns and Mill Road vineyards. Yellow apple and Anjou pear pop on the palate that ends on a yellow-grapefruit-peel finish, altogether clean and crisp.

title: Egeo 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mild, clean white-fruit aromas are generic but good. This feels round, with medium-level acidity. Pithy melon and citrus flavors are more bland than vivid on the finish. Drink now.
